com.emc.esu.api
Interface EsuApi

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractEsuRestApi, EsuApiJerseyAdapter, EsuRestApi, EsuRestApiApache, LBEsuRestApi, LBEsuRestApiApache
Deprecated. Use AtmosApi instead 

@Deprecated
public interface EsuApi

This interface defines the basic operations available through the ESU web services.

Method Detail

isUnicodeEnabled

boolean isUnicodeEnabled()
Deprecated. 

setUnicodeEnabled

void setUnicodeEnabled(boolean unicodeEnabled)
Deprecated. 

createObject

ObjectId createObject(Acl acl,
                      MetadataList metadata,
                      byte[] data,
                      String mimeType)
Deprecated. 
Creates a new object in the cloud.

Parameters:
acl - Access control list for the new object. May be null to use a default ACL
metadata - Metadata for the new object. May be null for no metadata.
data - The initial contents of the object. May be appended to later. May be null to create an object with no content.
mimeType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If data is non-null and mimeType is null, the MIME type will default to application/octet-stream.
Returns:
Identifier of the newly created object.
Throws:
EsuException - if the request fails.

createObject

ObjectId createObject(Acl acl,
                      MetadataList metadata,
                      byte[] data,
                      String mimeType,
                      Checksum checksum)
Deprecated. 
Creates a new object in the cloud.

Parameters:
acl - Access control list for the new object. May be null to use a default ACL
metadata - Metadata for the new object. May be null for no metadata.
data - The initial contents of the object. May be appended to later. May be null to create an object with no content.
mimeType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If data is non-null and mimeType is null, the MIME type will default to application/octet-stream.
checksum - if not null, use the Checksum object to compute the checksum for the create object request. If appending to the object with subsequent requests, use the same checksum object for each request.
Returns:
Identifier of the newly created object.
Throws:
EsuException - if the request fails.

createObjectFromStream

ObjectId createObjectFromStream(Acl acl,
                                MetadataList metadata,
                                InputStream data,
                                long length,
                                String mimeType)
Deprecated. 
Creates a new object in the cloud.

Parameters:
acl - Access control list for the new object. May be null to use a default ACL
metadata - Metadata for the new object. May be null for no metadata.
data - The initial contents of the object. May be appended to later. The stream will NOT be closed at the end of the request.
length - The length of the stream in bytes. If the stream is longer than the length, only length bytes will be written. If the stream is shorter than the length, an error will occur.
mimeType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If data is non-null and mimeType is null, the MIME type will default to application/octet-stream.
Returns:
Identifier of the newly created object.
Throws:
EsuException - if the request fails.

createObjectFromStreamOnPath

ObjectId createObjectFromStreamOnPath(ObjectPath path,
                                      Acl acl,
                                      MetadataList metadata,
                                      InputStream data,
                                      long length,
                                      String mimeType)
Deprecated. 
Creates a new object in the cloud.

Parameters:
path - The path to create the object on.
acl - Access control list for the new object. May be null to use a default ACL
metadata - Metadata for the new object. May be null for no metadata.
data - The initial contents of the object. May be appended to later. The stream will NOT be closed at the end of the request.
length - The length of the stream in bytes. If the stream is longer than the length, only length bytes will be written. If the stream is shorter than the length, an error will occur.
mimeType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If data is non-null and mimeType is null, the MIME type will default to application/octet-stream.
Returns:
Identifier of the newly created object.
Throws:
EsuException - if the request fails.

createObjectOnPath

ObjectId createObjectOnPath(ObjectPath path,
                            Acl acl,
                            MetadataList metadata,
                            byte[] data,
                            String mimeType)
Deprecated. 
Creates a new object in the cloud on the specified path.

Parameters:
path - The path to create the object on.
acl - Access control list for the new object. May be null to use a default ACL
metadata - Metadata for the new object. May be null for no metadata.
data - The initial contents of the object. May be appended to later. May be null to create an object with no content.
mimeType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If data is non-null and mimeType is null, the MIME type will default to application/octet-stream.
Returns:
the ObjectId of the newly-created object for references by ID.
Throws:
EsuException - if the request fails.

updateObject

void updateObject(Identifier id,
                  Acl acl,
                  MetadataList metadata,
                  Extent extent,
                  byte[] data,
                  String mimeType)
Deprecated. 
Updates an object in the cloud.

Parameters:
id - The ID of the object to update
acl - Access control list for the new object. Optional, default is NULL to leave the ACL unchanged.
metadata - Metadata list for the new object. Optional, default is NULL for no changes to the metadata.
data - The new contents of the object. May be appended to later. Optional, default is NULL (no content changes).
extent - portion of the object to update. May be null to indicate the whole object is to be replaced. If not null, the extent size must match the data size.
mimeType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If data is non-null and mimeType is null, the MIME type will default to application/octet-stream.
Throws:
EsuException - if the request fails.

updateObject

void updateObject(Identifier id,
                  Acl acl,
                  MetadataList metadata,
                  Extent extent,
                  byte[] data,
                  String mimeType,
                  Checksum checksum)
Deprecated. 
Updates an object in the cloud.

Parameters:
id - The ID of the object to update
acl - Access control list for the new object. Optional, default is NULL to leave the ACL unchanged.
metadata - Metadata list for the new object. Optional, default is NULL for no changes to the metadata.
data - The new contents of the object. May be appended to later. Optional, default is NULL (no content changes).
extent - portion of the object to update. May be null to indicate the whole object is to be replaced. If not null, the extent size must match the data size.
mimeType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If data is non-null and mimeType is null, the MIME type will default to application/octet-stream.
checksum - if not null, use the Checksum object to compute the checksum for the update object request. If appending to the object with subsequent requests, use the same checksum object for each request.
Throws:
EsuException - if the request fails.

setUserMetadata

void setUserMetadata(Identifier id,
                     MetadataList metadata)
Deprecated. 
Writes the metadata into the object. If the tag does not exist, it is created and set to the corresponding value. If the tag exists, the existing value is replaced.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the object to update
metadata - metadata to write to the object.

setAcl

void setAcl(Identifier id,
            Acl acl)
Deprecated. 
Sets (overwrites) the ACL on the object.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the object to change the ACL on.
acl - the new ACL for the object.

deleteObject

void deleteObject(Identifier id)
Deprecated. 
Deletes an object from the cloud.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the object to delete.

deleteVersion

void deleteVersion(ObjectId id)
Deprecated. 
Deletes a version of an object from the cloud.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the object to delete.

getUserMetadata

MetadataList getUserMetadata(Identifier id,
                             MetadataTags tags)
Deprecated. 
Fetches the user metadata for the object.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the object whose user metadata to fetch.
tags - A list of user metadata tags to fetch. Optional. If null, all user metadata will be fetched.
Returns:
The list of user metadata for the object.

getSystemMetadata

MetadataList getSystemMetadata(Identifier id,
                               MetadataTags tags)
Deprecated. 
Fetches the system metadata for the object.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the object whose system metadata to fetch.
tags - A list of system metadata tags to fetch. Optional. Default value is null to fetch all system metadata.
Returns:
The list of system metadata for the object.

readObject

byte[] readObject(Identifier id,
                  Extent extent,
                  byte[] buffer)
Deprecated. 
Reads an object's content.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the object whose content to read.
extent - the portion of the object data to read. Optional. Default is null to read the entire object.
buffer - the buffer to use to read the extent. Must be large enough to read the response or an error will be thrown. If null, a buffer will be allocated to hold the response data. If you pass a buffer that is larger than the extent, only extent.getSize() bytes will be valid.
Returns:
the object data read as a byte array.

readObject

byte[] readObject(Identifier id,
                  Extent extent,
                  byte[] buffer,
                  Checksum checksum)
Deprecated. 
Reads an object's content.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the object whose content to read.
extent - the portion of the object data to read. Optional. Default is null to read the entire object.
buffer - the buffer to use to read the extent. Must be large enough to read the response or an error will be thrown. If null, a buffer will be allocated to hold the response data. If you pass a buffer that is larger than the extent, only extent.getSize() bytes will be valid.
checksum - if not null, the given checksum object will be used to verify checksums during the read operation. Note that only erasure coded objects will return checksums *and* if you're reading the object in chunks, you'll have to read the data back sequentially to keep the checksum consistent. If the read operation does not return a checksum from the server, the checksum operation will be skipped.
Returns:
the object data read as a byte array.

readObjectStream

InputStream readObjectStream(Identifier id,
                             Extent extent)
Deprecated. 
Reads an object's content and returns an InputStream to read the content. Since the input stream is linked to the HTTP connection, it is imperative that you close the input stream as soon as you are done with the stream to release the underlying connection.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the object whose content to read.
extent - the portion of the object data to read. Optional. Default is null to read the entire object.
Returns:
an InputStream to read the object data.

Returns:
the object's ACL

getShareableUrl

URL getShareableUrl(Identifier id,
                    Date expiration)
Deprecated. 
An Atmos user (UID) can construct a pre-authenticated URL to an object, which may then be used by anyone to retrieve the object (e.g., through a browser). This allows an Atmos user to let a non-Atmos user download a specific object. The entire object/file is read.

Parameters:
id - the object to generate the URL for
expiration - the expiration date of the URL
Returns:
a URL that can be used to share the object's content

rename

void rename(ObjectPath source,
            ObjectPath destination,
            boolean force)
Deprecated. 
Renames a file or directory within the namespace.

Parameters:
source - The file or directory to rename
destination - The new path for the file or directory
force - If true, the desination file or directory will be overwritten. Directories must be empty to be overwritten. Also note that overwrite operations on files are not synchronous; a delay may be required before the object is available at its destination.

                    ObjectId vId)

id - Base object ID (target of the restore)
vId - Version object ID to restore

createObjectWithKey

ObjectId createObjectWithKey(String keyPool,
                             String key,
                             Acl acl,
                             MetadataList metadata,
                             byte[] data,
                             long length,
                             String mimeType)
Deprecated. 
Creates a new object in the cloud.

Parameters:
keyPool - A name which represents the keyspace for this key. A pool is analogous to an S3 bucket and two objects with the same name can exist in different pools.
key - The key that uniquely identifies this object within its keyPool.
acl - Access control list for the new object. May be null to use a default ACL
metadata - Metadata for the new object. May be null for no metadata.
data - The initial contents of the object. May be appended to later. May be null to create an object with no content.
length - The length of the stream in bytes. If the stream is longer than the length, only length bytes will be written. If the stream is shorter than the length, an error will occur.
mimeType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If data is non-null and mimeType is null, the MIME type will default to application/octet-stream.
Returns:
Identifier of the newly created object.
Throws:
EsuException - if the request fails.

createObjectWithKey

ObjectId createObjectWithKey(String keyPool,
                             String key,
                             Acl acl,
                             MetadataList metadata,
                             byte[] data,
                             long length,
                             String mimeType,
                             Checksum checksum)
Deprecated. 
Creates a new object in the cloud.

Parameters:
keyPool - A name which represents the keyspace for this key. A pool is analogous to an S3 bucket and two objects with the same name can exist in different pools.
key - The key that uniquely identifies this object within its keyPool.
acl - Access control list for the new object. May be null to use a default ACL
metadata - Metadata for the new object. May be null for no metadata.
data - The initial contents of the object. May be appended to later. May be null to create an object with no content.
length - The length of the stream in bytes. If the stream is longer than the length, only length bytes will be written. If the stream is shorter than the length, an error will occur.
mimeType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If data is non-null and mimeType is null, the MIME type will default to application/octet-stream.
checksum - if not null, use the Checksum object to compute the checksum for the create object request. If appending to the object with subsequent requests, use the same checksum object for each request.
Returns:
Identifier of the newly created object.
Throws:
EsuException - if the request fails.

length - The length of the stream in bytes. If the stream is longer than the length, only length bytes will be written. If the stream is shorter than the length, an error will occur.
mimeType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If data is non-null and mimeType is null, the MIME type will default to application/octet-stream.

readObjectWithKey

byte[] readObjectWithKey(String keyPool,
                         String key,
                         Extent extent,
                         byte[] buffer)
Deprecated. 
Reads an object's content.

Parameters:
keyPool - A name which represents the keyspace for this key. A pool is analogous to an S3 bucket and two objects with the same name can exist in different pools.
key - The key that uniquely identifies this object within its keyPool.
extent - the portion of the object data to read. Optional. Default is null to read the entire object.
buffer - the buffer to use to read the extent. Must be large enough to read the response or an error will be thrown. If null, a buffer will be allocated to hold the response data. If you pass a buffer that is larger than the extent, only extent.getSize() bytes will be valid.
Returns:
the object data read as a byte array.

readObjectWithKey

byte[] readObjectWithKey(String keyPool,
                         String key,
                         Extent extent,
                         byte[] buffer,
                         Checksum checksum)
Deprecated. 
Reads an object's content.

Parameters:
keyPool - A name which represents the keyspace for this key. A pool is analogous to an S3 bucket and two objects with the same name can exist in different pools.
key - The key that uniquely identifies this object within its keyPool.
extent - the portion of the object data to read. Optional. Default is null to read the entire object.
buffer - the buffer to use to read the extent. Must be large enough to read the response or an error will be thrown. If null, a buffer will be allocated to hold the response data. If you pass a buffer that is larger than the extent, only extent.getSize() bytes will be valid.
checksum - if not null, the given checksum object will be used to verify checksums during the read operation. Note that only erasure coded objects will return checksums *and* if you're reading the object in chunks, you'll have to read the data back sequentially to keep the checksum consistent. If the read operation does not return a checksum from the server, the checksum operation will be skipped.

the object data read as a byte array.

updateObjectWithKey

void updateObjectWithKey(String keyPool,
                         String key,
                         Acl acl,
                         MetadataList metadata,
                         Extent extent,
                         byte[] data,
                         String mimeType)
Deprecated. 
Updates an object in the cloud.

Parameters:
keyPool - A name which represents the keyspace for this key. A pool is analogous to an S3 bucket and two objects with the same name can exist in different pools.
key - The key that uniquely identifies this object within its keyPool.
acl - Access control list for the new object. Optional, default is NULL to leave the ACL unchanged.
metadata - Metadata list for the new object. Optional, default is NULL for no changes to the metadata.
data - The new contents of the object. May be appended to later. Optional, default is NULL (no content changes).
extent - portion of the object to update. May be null to indicate the whole object is to be replaced. If not null, the extent size must match the data size.
mimeType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If data is non-null and mimeType is null, the MIME type will default to application/octet-stream.
Throws:
EsuException - if the request fails.
